t: Hear*pn me, Lord,*s and answer me, for*ld I am poor and needy.
Guard*ln my life, for I am faithful to you; save*ld your servant who trusts in you. You*ln are my God;
have mercy on me, Lord, for*ld I call to you all day long.
Bring*ln joy to your servant, Lord, for*ld I put my trust in you.
You,*pn Lord, are forgiving and good, abounding*ld in love to all who call to you.
Hear*ln my prayer, Lord;*s listen*ld to my cry for mercy.
When*ln I am in distress, I call to you, because*ld you answer me.
Among*pn the gods there is none like you, Lord; no*ld deeds can compare with yours.
All*ln the nations you have made will*ld come and worship before you, Lord; they*ld will bring glory to your name.
For*ln you are great and do marvelous deeds; you*ld alone are God.
Teach*pn me your way, Lord,*s that*ld I may rely on your faithfulness; give*ln me an undivided heart, that*ld I may fear your name.
I*ln will praise you, Lord my God, with all my heart; I*ld will glorify your name forever.
For*ln great is your love toward me; you*ld have delivered me from the depths, from*ld the realm of the dead.
Arrogant*pn foes are attacking me, O God; ruthless*ld people are trying to kill meâ€” they*ld have no regard for you.
But*ln you, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow*ld to anger, abounding in love and faithfulness.
Turn*ln to me and have mercy on me; show*ld your strength in behalf of your servant; save*ln me, because I serve you just*ld as my mother did.
Give*ln me a sign of your goodness, that*ld my enemies may see it and be put to shame, for*ld you, Lord,*s have helped me and comforted me.
